decks.notes: This deck aims to win quickly by using infect creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Noble Hierarch and Invigorate to pump up its creatures and protect them with counterspells such as Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes powerful draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the combo pieces quickly. The land base is designed to provide the right colors of mana while also offering utility lands like Inkmoth Nexus and Wasteland for additional advantages.

The main focus of this Bomberman combo deck is to utilize Auriok Salvagers and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate infinite mana, allowing for the casting of Walking Ballista to finish off the opponent. Karn, the Great Creator provides utility and disruption, while Monastery Mentor creates additional threats. Artifact ramp and draw engines like Mishra's Bauble and Mystic Forge help to assemble the combo efficiently. Chalice of the Void and Cavern of Souls offer protection and disruption, while Wishclaw Talisman provides tutoring for key pieces. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token. The key strategy involves tutoring for Dark Depths with cards like Crop Rotation, while also disrupting the opponent with hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize. The deck includes protection against opposing cards with Pithing Needle and Bayou, as well as ways to deal with threats such as Abrupt Decay and Assassin's Trophy. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through a powerful combo finish.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently reanimate powerful creatures such as Griselbrand by utilizing cards like Entomb, Animate Dead, and Reanimate. The deck aims to take advantage of graveyard manipulation and fast mana generation through cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to bring back creatures from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. Additionally, disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Unmask are included to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your own combo pieces.

The main idea of this Elves combo deck is to generate mana quickly with cards like Heritage Druid and Nettle Sentinel, allowing you to play powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Ruric Thar, the Unbowed. The deck also focuses on card draw with Elvish Visionary and Glimpse of Nature, ensuring you have the resources you need to execute your combo efficiently. Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith help you tutor for key pieces, while Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger provide additional utility. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and explosive combination of creatures and spells.

The main idea behind this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly in order to cast multiple spells in the same turn, eventually leading to a lethal Tendrils of Agony. The combination of rituals, fast mana sources, and card draw spells allows the player to efficiently assemble the necessary pieces to win the game in a single explosive turn. The inclusion of Burning Wish adds versatility to the deck by giving access to a sideboard of impactful spells that can be used to close out the game or interact with the opponent as needed.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo, which allows you to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token in just one turn. To support this combo, the deck includes cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Elvish Reclaimer to search for the necessary lands. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Pithing Needle to control the opponent's resources and protect your combo. By efficiently assembling and protecting the combo, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure the win.

This deck aims to assemble the Cephalid Breakfast combo quickly, utilizing Nomads en-Kor and Cephalid Illusionist to mill the entire library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes various ways to search for combo pieces, protect the combo, and disrupt the opponent's plans. With Aether Vial for cheating creatures into play, along with powerful spells like Brainstorm and Ponder for manipulation, this deck is focused on executing the combo efficiently and effectively to secure victory. It is a high-risk, high-reward strategy that can catch opponents off guard.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Sliver tribe's synergies to create a fast and aggressive gameplay, overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures that boost each other's strengths. By combining various Sliver abilities such as flying, protection, and pumping power and toughness, the deck aims to control the board and quickly take down the opponent's life total. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Force of Will and Unsettled Mariner provides protection and utility to ensure the Slivers can execute their game plan effectively. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to support consistent and efficient casting of the Sliver creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly and efficiently milling cards into the graveyard to enable powerful graveyard synergies. By utilizing cards like Altar of Dementia and Faithless Looting, the deck can quickly fill the graveyard with creatures like Vengevine, Hogaak, and Bloodghast. The deck also includes creatures like Stitcher's Supplier and Putrid Imp to help with the milling process. Once enough creatures are in the graveyard, the deck can use cards like Bridge from Below to create an army of tokens and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck is focused on utilizing cheap spells and aggressive creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By using cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Chain Lightning to target the opponent directly, alongside creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Blistercoil Weird, the goal is to pressure the opponent early and often. Additionally, cards like Faithless Looting and Manamorphose help dig for more threats and keep the hand full. The deck also includes Arclight Phoenix and Bedlam Reveler as powerful finishers to close out games.

The focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana through Cloudpost lands and use efficient tutors like Green Sun's Zenith and Once Upon a Time to find key combo pieces such as Primeval Titan and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. By utilizing cards like Crop Rotation and Vesuva to copy Cloudposts, the deck aims to flood the board with powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Kozilek, overwhelming the opponent. Additionally, cards like Bojuka Bog and Pithing Needle help disrupt the opponent's strategy while providing protection for the ramp plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing Merfolk creatures and synergies to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It also includes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Merfolk Trickster to control the board and protect key pieces. Additionally, the inclusion of Paradigm Shift along with Thassa's Oracle provides an alternative win condition. The deck aims to curve out efficiently using Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls, while also having some versatile sideboard options like Vendilion Clique and Oko, Thief of Crowns for additional disruption and card advantage.

The deck relies on a combination of powerful planeswalkers, efficient creatures, and disruptive spells to control the game and outvalue the opponent. Stoneforge Mystic helps tutor up powerful equipment like Batterskull and the swords to boost creatures. With strong cards like True-Name Nemesis and Snapcaster Mage, the deck can apply pressure while maintaining control. The inclusion of counter spells like Force of Will and removal like Swords to Plowshares allows the deck to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to control the game with a mix of card advantage, disruption, and threats.

The deck is focused on quickly generating mana and casting spells to build up to a powerful combo finish with Goblin Charbelcher. The deck aims to speed through the deck with cards like Burning Wish and Echo of Eons to find key pieces like Lion's Eye Diamond and Rite of Flame, allowing for explosive plays. By emptying the hand and casting spells for a quick burst of mana, the deck can activate Goblin Charbelcher to deal massive damage to the opponent in one turn.

The deck focuses on using various control elements such as Oko, Thief of Crowns, Dark Confidant, and Abrupt Decay to disrupt the opponent's strategy while utilizing Life from the Loam to recycle lands and generate card advantage. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to apply pressure on the opponent. Additionally, Chalice of the Void and Mox Diamond help to control the board and ramp up mana production. The mana base is well-structured to support the deck's strategy with a mix of dual lands, fetch lands, and utility lands like Wasteland and Karakas.
